section.content: Ah... spring... Let's hope that its coming will thaw away the icy silence of Lupin news. Here is what we have for this month though.

section.title: 1974 Live-action movie coming to DVD
section.content:
Hard to believe, but the 1974 live-action Lupin film is getting the DVD treatment in Japan. Not only that, it is getting the full anamorphic treatment, will include the theatrical trailer, and will include an interview with the director. It will hit the streets of Japan on 28 May for a retail price of 4800¥

With its release, the only title yet to have a DVD release will be Trailers History. Can that title be too far behind? Credit goes to "ObiKenobi" of the AoD forums for spotting the pre-order.

section.title: PS2 strategy guide is dead
section.content:
Apparently, the legal discussions broke down, and Doublejump will be unable to publish their strategy guide for the PS2 game in any form. Both Doublejump and Bandai get a huge thumbs down for dropping the business and marketing ball on this one.

The only upside is that the guide's creator is willing to answer any and all pleas for help in the Doublejump forum.

section.title: Monkey Punch manga released in Japan
section.content: A new (possibly old reissued) manga from Monkey Punch hit Japanese shelves on 17 March. Titled TacTicS, it appears to revolve around the exploits of a business man. Credit goes to group member Daniel Zelter for spotting it.

section.title: Cagliostro to air on Japanese TV
section.content: All the news seems to be coming out of Japan this month; NTV will broadcast the classic film Cagliostro on 26 March.

section.title: Upcoming & Recent Releases
section.content:
11 Feb 2004:
Lupin the 3rd (US PS2, Bandai/Dreamworks)
2 March 2004:
Lupin III Volume 12 (manga, TokyoPop)
13 April 2004:
Lupin the 3rd TV 6: Lupin the Target (R1 DVD, Geneon)
4 May 2004:
Lupin III Volume 13 (manga, TokyoPop)
28 May 2004:
Lupin III: Nenriki Chinsakusen (R2 DVD, Toho)
6 July 2004:
Lupin III Volume 14 (manga, TokyoPop)

section.title: Parting Shots
section.content: With the US convention season starting, I hope Funimation, Tokyopop, and Geneon will have some exciting Lupin news for us. Beyond that, I really need to get my hands on that PS2 game; well, I need to get my hands on a PS2 also, but that's beside the point. :)
